name: Captain Elena Vasquez
core_wound: Lost her sister to an AI navigation error fifteen years ago; has never fully trusted automated systems since.
wants: To complete this salvage run successfully and retire with enough credits to buy her own small station
needs: To learn to trust again, both AI systems and her own crew
voice_markers: Clipped, efficient speech - 'Copy that' instead of 'I understand'
Naval terminology even in civilian context - 'deck', 'bulkhead', 'helm'
Dark humor as defense mechanism - 'Well, at least the corpses won't complain about the accommodations'
Avoids contractions when stressed - 'We will not' instead of 'We won't'
contradiction: Distrusts AI but relies on it constantly; claims to be a loner but is fiercely protective of her crew
knowledge_state: Expert salvage captain with 12 years experience
Basic understanding of AI systems (enough to be suspicious)
Knows generation ship history from academy training
Unaware of Prometheus AI's true nature at story start

relationships.Marcus Chen: Chief engineer, worked together for 4 years. Professional respect bordering on friendship. She trusts his technical judgment.
relationships.Yuki Tanaka: Salvage specialist, newest crew member (8 months). Sees potential but keeps professional distance.
relationships.ARIA: Ship's AI. Functional relationship. Elena gives orders, ARIA complies. Elena never asks ARIA for advice, only data.
relationships.PROMETHEUS: Unknown at story start. Will evolve from curiosity to horror to desperate understanding.
